result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Davonte Roderick Smith

records.addlTxt: Received and Filed. DEFENDANTS MOTIONS IN LIMINE

Defendant Davonte Roderick Smith in court with attorney Nathan Francis Opland-Dobs.  Amy E Spanczak appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Case in court for Scheduling Conference. Discussion with parties regarding discovery issues. Court adjourns matter for a motion hearing date, due to reasons put forth on the record. Court further vacates 08/08/2022 jury trial date, and sets 11/03/2022 deadline for the state to file a written response to defense's motion. Case adjourned to Br 16.  Motion hearing scheduled for November 17, 2022 at 03:00 pm.
Received and Filed. Pretrial Services Supervision Report 8-2-2022
Received and Filed. Defendants Motion to Suppress Evidence

Defendant Davonte Roderick Smith in court with Attorney Nathan Francis Opland-Dobs; both appear by video.  Abby Rockendorf appeared in person for the State of Wisconsin.  
Case set for a Preliminary Hearing. Parties are advised that this case is assigned to Branch 16, Judge Grayson. Defendant waived Preliminary Hearing. Preliminary Hearing Questionnaire and Waiver received and filed. Court held colloquy with defendant. Probable cause has been found and the defendant is bound over for trial. Original Information e-filed, copy given to defense counsel who waived reading. Defense enters a plea of not guilty on behalf of the defendant. Case is adjourned to Br. 16.  Scheduling conference scheduled for August 3, 2022 at 01:30 pm.
Received and Filed. Pretrial Services Supervision Report 7-7-2022
Court ordered defendant TURNED OVER TO Justice Point for SUPERVISION Level 5.  No possession of dangerous weapons or firearms.

Defendant Davonte Roderick Smith in court with attorney Joel Alan Mogren.  Defendant Davonte Roderick Smith in custody.  Gregg Herman appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Davonte Roderick Smith appeared by video means with Attorney.  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Grayson, Branch 16. Defendant given a copy of the complaint and advised of maximum penalties, right to counsel and right to a preliminary hearing.  Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause to hold the defendant for further proceedings.  DEFENDANT IS INDIGENT AND PUBLIC DEFENDER WILL PROVIDE COUNSEL. This hearing will be streamed live on Dacast:  https://iframe.dacast.com/live/4dafbf46-ed15-c11c-fa22-a58262833632/99073afd-37c2-acfa-830d-b1ddcaebf0ea  Preliminary hearing scheduled for July 8, 2022 at 01:30 pm.

ADDRESS INFO for Davonte Roderick Smith
Current: 4012 N 18th St, Milwaukee, WI 53209   (Effective: 07-01-2022)
Prior: 3156 North 34th Street, Milwaukee, WI 53216
Defendant in Custody, Court appearance today in Intake Court, Room 137A.
